task_summary: Pick up a shoe placed on a flat blue surface using a robotic manipulator.

task_long_description.overview: The purpose of this behavior tree is to direct a robot to pick up a single shoe from a blue surface, as observed in the visual frames. The robot must search for and reliably detect the shoe, align above it, open its gripper, compute and move to a suitable grasp pose, perform a top-down grasp, and confirm that the shoe has been picked up. The sequence is robust to minor misdetections and uses visual confirmation and retries where needed.
preconditions: Shoe is on a blue background within reachable workspace.
Robot gripper is free and operational.
Camera system is functioning and able to perceive the shoe.
stepwise_plan: Check if the shoe is already visible.
Scan using a grid pattern up to 3 times if not immediately visible.
Detect the shoe and refine its pose.
Move the gripper above the shoe (offset in z).
Compute a top grasp pose and align precisely.
Execute a top-down grasp at the computed pose.
Verify that the shoe is secured in the gripper.
success_criteria: Shoe is firmly held in the gripper post-execution.
No visible collision or dropped object post-grasp.
No failure at any verification stage.
failure_and_recovery: If the shoe is not visible, retry scanning up to 3 times.
If grasp is not successful, task ends; recovery (not in tree) would require higher-level re-planning.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate if the shoe is detected in the gripper or if retries/timeouts are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the shoe is visible.
Scan for shoe using grid pattern.
Moves to a position above shoe.
Calculates top-down grasp pose for shoe.

failure_modes: Shoe not detected (perception failure or occlusion).
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for visibility, up to 3 times.
Fail task if shoe cannot be grasped or verified in gripper.
assumptions: Frames indicate only one object (shoe); no distractors present.
Shoe identity confirmed visually in all frames.
Grasp force and tolerance not specified, using defaults.
No obstruction or inside-container scenario, despite possible partial occlusion in mid-sequence frames.

expected_success_criteria: Shoe is detected, grasped, and confirmed in gripper.
